name: B. Rising Sand
statement:
There are n piles of sand where the i-th pile has a_i blocks of sand.
The i-th pile is called if 1 < i < n and a_i > a_{i-1} + a_{i+1}. That
is, a pile is too tall if it has more sand than its two neighbours
combined. (Note that piles on the ends of the array cannot be too
tall.)You are given an integer k. An operation consists of picking k
consecutive piles of sand and adding one unit of sand to them all.
Formally, pick 1
leq l,r
leq n such that r-l+1=k. Then for all l
leq i
leq r, update a_i
gets a_i+1.What is the number of piles that can simultaneously be too
tall after some (possibly zero) operations?
